title: U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS) Office for Civil Rights (OCR) / MEDEIROS (Department of Health and Human Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request

Date: February 7, 2025

To:
U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS)
Office for Civil Rights (OCR)
ATTN: FOIA Officer
JFK Federal Building, Room 1875
Boston, MA 02203
Fax: (617) 565-3809

Subject: FOIA Request for All Records Related to OCR Transaction No. 01-25-595812
Dear FOIA Officer,

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (5 U.S.C. § 552), I am requesting copies of all records, communications, internal memos, and related documents associated with the review and closure of my civil rights complaint filed with the U.S. Department of Health & Human Services (HHS) Office for Civil Rights (OCR), Transaction No. 01-25-595812.

1. Scope of Request
I am specifically requesting:

All internal communications (emails, memos, notes, reports, and case evaluations) related to OCR’s review and determination of my complaint.
All correspondence between OCR staff, including but not limited to Laurie Senat, Barbara C. Stampul, Pam Bindi, and any other officials involved in the case review and closure.
Any legal analyses or justifications used to support the decision to close my complaint without further investigation.
All case file documentation, including investigative records, reports, and any documents submitted by third parties.
Records of any communications or directives from HHS leadership regarding how complaints such as mine are handled or prioritized.

2. Request for Expedited Processing
Given the civil rights implications of this case, I request expedited processing under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E). The release of these records is in the public interest, as it pertains to the enforcement of federal civil rights laws, ADA compliance, and government transparency regarding critical healthcare and human services protections.

3. Request for Fee Waiver
I request a fee waiver pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(4)(A)(iii), as the requested information is sought in the public interest and is not for commercial use. The requested records will contribute significantly to public understanding of government operations, civil rights enforcement, and HHS compliance practices.

4. Format of Response
I request that responsive records be provided electronically in PDF format via email or secure digital link. If any portion of the requested records is exempt from disclosure, please provide a detailed index justifying each exemption under Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

5. Legal Obligation to Respond
Per 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i), you are required to respond to this request within 20 business days. If you require additional time, please provide a detailed written explanation for the delay.


Failure to comply with this request in a timely manner may result in further legal and administrative action to enforce compliance with FOIA. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Founder, ABI Resources
Whistleblower & Advocate for Constitutional Rights

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS
